required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Baricitinib in Participants With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Double-Blind, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of Baricitinib in Patients With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this long term study is to see how safe and effective the study drug known as baricitinib is in participants with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) who have completed the final treatment visit of study I4V-MC-JAHZ (NCT03616912) or study I4V-MC-JAIA (NCT03616964).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs)
Percentage of Participants with Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
Percentage of Participants with Temporary Investigational Product Interruptions
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with temporary investigational product interruptions

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Permanent Investigational Product Discontinuations
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with permanent investigational product discontinuations

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Responder Index 4 (SRI-4) Response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving SRI-4 response

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Lupus Low Disease Activity State (LLDAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a LLDAS

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Prednisone Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in prednisone dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Safety of Estrogens in Lupus Erythematosus National Assessment (SELENA)-Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index (SLEDAI) Flare Index Flare Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized SELENA-SLEDAI flare index flare rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus Disease Area and Severity Index (CLASI) Total Activity Score ≥10 at Baseline with ≥50% Reduction in CLASI Total Activity Score
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with CLASI total activity score ≥10 at baseline with ≥50% reduction in CLASI total activity score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Tender Joint Count
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in tender joint count

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Swollen Joint Count
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in swollen joint count

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Systemic Lupus International Collaborating Clinics/American College of Rheumatology (SLICC/ACR) Damage Index Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in SLICC/ACR damage index total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Worst Pain Numeric Rating Scale (NRS)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in worst pain NRS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have completed the final treatment study visit of an originating study, such as study JAHZ (NCT03616912) or Study JAIA (NCT03616964).

link.description: A Study of Baricitinib in Participants With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
